quizTitle: DBMS - Unit 4: Schema Refinement and Normalization

questions.questionText: What is the main purpose of normalization in databases?
options: To remove data anomalies and redundancy
To reduce the number of tables
questions.correctAnswer: To remove data anomalies and redundancy

questions.questionText: A relation is in 1NF if:
A functional dependency X → Y is said to hold when:
options: Each X value is associated with multiple Y values
Each Y value determines X value
Each X value determines exactly one Y value
There is no relationship between X and Y
questions.correctAnswer: Each X value determines exactly one Y value

questions.questionText: Which of the following is true for Second Normal Form (2NF)?
A table is in Third Normal Form (3NF) if:
options: It is in 2NF and every non-key attribute depends only on the primary key

questions.questionText: Boyce-Codd Normal Form (BCNF) is a stronger version of:
In BCNF, for every non-trivial functional dependency X → Y:
options: X must be a candidate key
Y must be a candidate key

questions.questionText: Lossless join decomposition ensures that:
options: Data is lost when relations are joined
No data is lost when relations are joined
questions.correctAnswer: No data is lost when relations are joined

questions.questionText: Dependency preserving decomposition ensures that:
options: All functional dependencies are preserved after decomposition
questions.correctAnswer: All functional dependencies are preserved after decomposition

questions.questionText: A surrogate key is:
options: A primary key chosen by the user
A natural key based on real data
An artificial key created by the system
A foreign key in another table
questions.correctAnswer: An artificial key created by the system

questions.questionText: MVD stands for:
A relation is in 4NF if:
options: It is in BCNF and has no multi-valued dependencies
It is in 3NF and has atomic attributes
questions.correctAnswer: It is in BCNF and has no multi-valued dependencies

questions.questionText: The fifth normal form (5NF) deals with:
Which of the following ensures both lossless join and dependency preservation?
Which of the following normal forms is based on multi-valued dependencies?
Functional dependency A → B means:
options: A and B are composite keys

questions.questionText: Which of the following anomalies does normalization reduce?
Which normal form ensures no non-trivial join dependencies?
A table having a transitive dependency violates which normal form?
Normalization is used to achieve which property?
